1. Overview

This document describes the RESTful web services exposed on the Baxi platform that enables business partners to sell different products and track their account.

Baxi RESTful web services use data in JSON format for both input and output operations.

HTTP request Accept header should be set to application/json

JSON request parameters should be placed inside the Request Body

2. Integration Flow

This section contains a description of recommended integration flow that helps minimize the risk of disputing transactions and also increase customer confidence in the system.

  1. If the service has proxy method(s) available for validating the customer or for fetching available products, those methods should be used first in order to make sure the customer is properly identified on provider platform and that products customer wishes to purchase are available at the moment. For some services, information obtained in this step are mandatory for the follow-up: some services require that information obtained through the proxy methods is printed on receipts, some send additional information that can be used in validating exchange request (such as minimum amount for the transaction). This information is provided in individual services section under Proxy method description.

  2. In case step 1 is successfully completed, an Exchange request can be sent.

To verify if the transaction has been fully processed ALWAYS verify the value of the status response parameter of the Exchange method. This parameter determines whether the transaction is successful or has definitely failed.
This parameter can contain only 2 values: ACCEPTED and REJECTED. In case the status is ACCEPTED, the transaction was successful. In case the status is REJECTED, the transaction has failed.
Individual services have additional response parameters that may shed more light why the transaction failed. However, the ONLY criteria that should be used to determine if the transaction was successful or not is the status response parameter of the Exchange method. Regardless if the status value is ACCEPTED or REJECTED, Exchange method is finished at that point and the transaction is in its final state.

Possible alternative scenarios to an ideal step 2 include a connection timeout or an error response sent by the BAXI platform.

  • In case of a connection timeout you can safely resend the Exchange request � Exchange operation is an idempotent operation.

  • In case an error response is received (HTTP code other than 200), the response will also contain an error code and message in JSON format in the response body. Depending on the error code, additional steps may be needed to make sure Exchange is properly finished. Please consult the Appendix B for error code descriptions and actions required.
    As stated in the Appendix B, in case the received error code is not listed, contact Capricorn Digital support immediately.

    • If the error code suggests that further action is required using API (Exchange / Query), the recommended step is to:

      • Retry with the identical Exchange method call (including the same unique reference) 3 times in an interval of 45 seconds between the calls.

      • In case the transaction is still not resolved after calling the Exchange method as described above, initiate Query method calls until a response signaling the transaction is resolved is received. (through status parameter as described earlier). Calls to Query method should not be issued in an interval of less than 1 minute. If Query method response returns with an HTTP status 200 (OK), the body of the response will contain the transaction details as if it were a normal Exchange request and the Exchange can be considered finished. In case of a timeout you can safely resend the Query request. If the transaction is still not resolved after 5 minutes please contact CDL support.

    • In case of an error that suggests the Exchange was issued to the provider, the client should try to Cancel the transaction IF cancellation is available for that service. Whether a service supports cancellation is covered in individual service sections.

If the Exchange scenario requires a cancellation and Cancel is available for the service, a call to Cancel method should be issued. If a response with HTTP status 200(OK) and transactionNumber parameter is received in the body, you can consider exchange to be successfully cancelled and finished. In case of a timeout you can safely resend the cancel request, it is an idempotent operation.
In case the service does not support cancellation or if Cancel request returns with an error response, the client needs to contact Capricorn Digital support in order to resolve the issue.

3. Available Services

3.1. Get Balance

Get Balance operation enables Baxi integrator to fetch the current balance available on the Baxi platform that can be used to sell services

Service method

balance

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/finance/status

HTTP Method

GET

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

balance

Number

M

The current balance on the platform.

lastDeposit

string

M

Date and time of the last deposit made on the platform in format yyyy-MM-dd’T’HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX
Sample Response Body:
{
                                    "balance": 149806,
                                    "lastDeposit": "2016-01-15T15:42:18.46+01:00"
}

3.2. Get Allowed Services

Get Allowed Services operation enables Baxi integrator to fetch currently available services for the provided integrator.

Service method

services

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange/services

HTTP Method

GET

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

N/A

Array of composite objects

M

Contains the description of available services. Each service is described using 'ServiceDescriptor' object.
Response Body: 'ServiceDescriptor' object:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

serviceId

string

M

Code identifying the service. The Appendix A contains all available service codes

description

string

M

Description of the service.

blocked

boolean

M

Flag indicating if the service is blocked.
Sample Response Body:
[
        {
                                    "serviceId": "ACA",
                                    "description": "Airtel Prepaid Recharge",
                                    "blocked": true
        },
        {
                                    "serviceId": "ADA",
                                    "description": "Glo Prepaid Recharge",
                                    "blocked": false
        }
]

3.3. Get Fees

This method enables Baxi integrator to fetch fees that are to be applied when using the service. Get Fees method needs to be called just before Exchange request is issued. In case a service requires a call to get the fees, it will be displayed as a warning at the beginning of individual service description sections.

Service method

get fees

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange/fees

HTTP Method

POST

Request

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

serviceId

string

M

Service Code

serviceHandlerId

string

M

Hard-coded value "CDL"

amount

Number

M

Base amount

details

Composite object

M

Service specific key-value map that contains service specific request parameters. Details provided need to be identical to the details object in Exchange method, without the amount, serviceFee and providerFee params.

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

Content-Type: application/json

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

amount

Number

M

Total amount - represents the total amount of the transaction that takes into account base amount, service fee and provider fee. This value needs to be sent as the amount param in the details object of the Exchange method

serviceFee

Number

M

Service fee - should be sent along in the details object of the Exchange method

providerFee

Number

M

Provider fee - should be sent along in the details object of the Exchange method
Sample Request Body:
{
                                    "serviceId":"BZC",
                                    "serviceHandlerId":"CDL",
                                    "amount":1000,
                                    "details":{
                                    "accountNumber":"123456789",
                                    "bankCode":"030",
                                    "bankName":"Heritage Bank",
                                    "customerName":"John T. Ester"
    }
}
Sample Response Body:
{
                                    "amount":1050,
                                    "providerFee":0,
                                    "serviceFee":50
}

3.4. Exchange

Exchange operation allows the Baxi integrator to execute a sale for a provided service. Format of the JSON request differs from service to service and will be covered individually in respective service sections.

Service method

exchange

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange

HTTP Method

POST

Request

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

id

Number

M

Unique request ID generated on integrator’s platform

serviceId

String

M

Code identifying the service. The Appendix A contains all available service codes

paymentCollectorId

String

M

Hard-coded value "CDL"

paymentMethod

String

M

Hard-coded value "PREPAID"

details

Composite object

M

Service specific key-value map that contains service specific request parameters. Details for individual services are covered in service specific sections

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

Content-Type: application/json

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

transactionNumber

Number

M

Unique transaction reference for the transaction generated on Baxi platform.

details

Composite object

M

Service specific key-value map that contains various relevant information. Details for the various responses are covered in service specific sections

3.5. Cancel

Some services allow cancellation depending on certain circumstances. Whether a service supports cancellation and what are the circumstances under which transactions can be cancelled are described in individual service sections

Service method

cancel

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange/cancel

HTTP Method

POST

Request

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

id

Number

M

Unique request ID generated on integrator’s platform during the exchange operation

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

Content-Type: application/json

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

transactionNumber

Number

M

Unique transaction reference for the original transaction generated on Baxi platform for a, now, cancelled transaction
Sample Request Body:
{
                                    "id": 132616
}
Sample Response Body:
{
                                    "transactionNumber": 1616206
}

3.6. Query

Query operation enables the third-party integrator to retrieve all details regarding a previously issued exchange request. That way the integrator can fetch the results of a particular transaction.

Service method

query

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange/query

HTTP Method

POST

Request

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

id

Number

M

Unique request ID generated on integrator’s platform during the exchange operation

Request Headers

Authorization: Description of this security header will be covered in a separate section

Content-Type: application/json

x-msp-date: current date/time in RFC 1123 format

Response

Parameter Name

Type

Mandatory / Optional

Description

transactionNumber

Number

M

Unique transaction reference for the original transaction generated on Baxi.

details

Composite object

M

Service specific key-value map that contains various relevant information regarding the original transaction from the related exchange operation
Sample Request Body:
{
                                    "id": 132616
}
Sample Response:

The same as exchange response, which will be covered in individual service sections

3.7. Proxy

This operation enables integrators to fetch all relevant information specific to the service prior to issuing an exchange request. This step is usually useful with customer validation, or fetching some important data prior to submitting an exchange operation. Specific service sections will include additional information on the availability of proxy operations

Service method

proxy

Request URL (TEST)

https://test.platform.baxibox.com/app/rest/consumer/v2/exchange/proxy

4. INDIVIDUAL SERVICES

This section will cover specific details for each of the services available.

4.1. AIRTEL VTU

4.1.1. Service ID: ACA

4.1.2. Exchange:

Request Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

phoneNumber

string

M

Customer’s mobile phone number

amount

Number

M

Top up amount in Naira (NGN)
Sample Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "phoneNumber": "08777722222",
                                        "amount": 100
        },
                                        "id": 151,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "ACA"
}
Response Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

status

string

M

Status of the transaction. Can be one of ACCEPTED OR REJECTED

statusCode

string

O

Status code from Airtel, 200 signifies success.

responseMessage

string

O

Response message from Airtel

exchangeReference

string

O

Unique reference number generated on Airtel platform
Sample Response Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "status": "ACCEPTED",
                                        "statusCode": "200",
                                        "responseMessage": "Successful Transaction",
                                        "exchangeReference": "R151230.0835.22"
        },
                                        "transactionNumber": 1734121
}

4.1.3. Query

Sample Response Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "status": "ACCEPTED",
                                        "statusCode": "200",
                                        "responseMessage": "Successful Transaction",
                                        "exchangeReference": "R151230.0835.22"
        },
                                        "transactionNumber": 1734121
}

4.1.4. Cancel

Cancellation is not available for this service

4.1.5. Proxy

No proxy operations available for this service

Request Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

phoneNumber

string

M

Customer’s mobile phone number

amount

Number

M

Top up amount in Naira (NGN)
Sample Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "phoneNumber": "08777722222",
                                        "amount": 100
        },
                                        "id": 151,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AEA"
}
Response Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

status

string

M

Status of the transaction. Can be one of ACCEPTED OR REJECTED

statusCode

string

O

Status code from Etisalat, together with response code indicates actual error

responseCode

string

O

Response code from Etisalat, together with status code indicates actual error. Combination of status code 0 and response code of 0 indicates successful transaction

responseMessage

string

O

Response message from Etisalat

exchangeReference

string

O

Unique reference number generated on Etisalat platform
Sample Response Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "status": "ACCEPTED",
                                        "statusCode": "0",
                                        "responseCode": "0",
                                        "responseMessage": "Successful Transaction",
                                        "exchangeReference": "0117211228025506"
        },
                                        "transactionNumber": 1734121
}

4.3.3. Query

Sample Response Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "status": "ACCEPTED",
                                        "statusCode": "0",
                                        "responseCode": "0",
                                        "responseMessage": "Successful Transaction",
                                        "exchangeReference": "0117211228025506"
        },
                                        "transactionNumber": 1734121
}

4.5. ETISALAT Bundle

4.5.1. Service ID: AEC

4.11. MultiChoice DSTV

MultiChoice services (DStv and GOTv) provide various options for making payments. Each of them will be described below with provided samples.

4.11.1. Service ID: AQA

4.11.2. Exchange:

Request Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

customerNumber

Number

M

Customer number. Retrieved in smart card validation proxy method call - VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER.

smartcardNumber

Number

M

Smartcard number provided in the customer validation step.

customerName

string

M

Customer name. Retrieved in smart card validation proxy method call - VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER.

invoicePeriod

Number

M

Invoice period for which the payment is made. Available options for specific products can be retrieved from the Proxy method calls. In case of RENEW and BOX OFFICE options it can be retrieved from VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER, while in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS should be used.

amount

Number

M

Total transaction amount

productsCodes

Array of strings

M

An array of product / addon codes selected. Codes can be fetched from the related Proxy method calls FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS. Product codes should only be sent in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option.

monthsPaidFor

Number

O

Number of months the product will be paid for by paying the provided price (can be fetched from related Proxy method calls FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option or fixed value 1 in case of RENEW and BOX OFFICE).

subscriptionType

string

M

Subscription type. Must be "STANDARD" in case of RENEW and CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION options or "BOX_OFFICE" in case of BOX OFFICE.

RENEW option is a regular way of renewing an existing subscription. Outstanding amount for an existing subscription as well as due date for the payment can be retrieved from proxy call - GET_DUE_DATE_AND_AMOUNT. Customer is allowed to pay a different amount than the one retrieved in proxy method call.

Sample RENEW Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "productsCodes": [],
                                        "customerNumber": 275953782,
                                        "smartcardNumber": 4131953321,
                                        "customerName": "E INI OBONG BASSEY",
                                        "invoicePeriod": 1,
                                        "monthsPaidFor": 1,
                                        "subscriptionType": "STANDARD",
                                        "amount": 2500
        },
                                        "id": 6,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AQA"
}

BOX OFFICE option should be used in case the customer has a box office plan and wants to make a payment for it specifically. Verification of an existing box office account can be done using a proxy method - VALIDATE_BOX_OFFICE_CUSTOMER.

Sample BOX OFFICE Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "productsCodes": [],
                                        "customerNumber": 275953782,
                                        "smartcardNumber": 4131953321,
                                        "customerName": "E INI OBONG BASSEY",
                                        "invoicePeriod": 1,
                                        "monthsPaidFor": 1,
                                        "subscriptionType": "BOX_OFFICE",
                                        "amount": 410
        },
                                        "id": 6,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AQA"
}

CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option should be used only in case the customer would like to change the current product / add-ons he/she is subscribed to at the moment. Product codes of new products and add-ons MUST BE included in request in this case.

Sample Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "productsCodes": [
                                        "COFAME36",
                                        "FRN7E36"
                ],
                                        "customerNumber": 275953782,
                                        "smartcardNumber": 4131953321,
                                        "customerName": "E INI OBONG BASSEY",
                                        "invoicePeriod": 1,
                                        "monthsPaidFor": 1,
                                        "subscriptionType": "STANDARD",
                                        "amount": 8760
        },
                                        "id": 6,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AQA"
}
Response Body: 'details' parameter:

Response object is the same for all options.

4.11.4. Cancel

Cancellation is not available for this service

4.11.5. Proxy

Several proxy operations are available for this service. The field requestType in details parameter is used to tell apart different proxy operations.

Validate smart-card number

Used to check if smart-card number is valid. If so returns the customer name, account status, due date and customer number. This proxy method should be called as entry method for all options.

4.12. MultiChoice GOTV

MultiChoice services (DStv and GOTv) provide various options for making payments. Each of them will be described below with provided samples.

4.12.1. Service ID: AQC

4.12.2. Exchange:

Request Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

customerNumber

Number

M

Customer number. Retrieved in smart card validation proxy method call - VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER.

smartcardNumber

Number

M

Smartcard number provided in the customer validation step.

customerName

string

M

Customer name. Retrieved in smart card validation proxy method call - VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER.

invoicePeriod

Number

M

Invoice period for which the payment is made. Available options for specific products can be retrieved from the Proxy method calls. In case of RENEW option it can be retrieved from VALIDATE_DEVICE_NUMBER, while in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS should be used.

amount

Number

M

Total transaction amount

productsCodes

Array of strings

M

An array of product / addon codes selected. Codes can be fetched from the related Proxy method calls FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS. Product codes should only be sent in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option.

monthsPaidFor

Number

O

Number of months the product will be paid for by paying the provided price (can be fetched from related Proxy method calls FIND_STANDALONE_PRODUCTS and FIND_PRODUCT_ADDONS in case of CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option or fixed value 1 in case of RENEW).

subscriptionType

string

M

Subscription type. Hard-coded value "STANDARD".

RENEW option is a regular way of renewing an existing subscription. Outstanding amount for an existing subscription as well as due date for the payment can be retrieved from proxy call - GET_DUE_DATE_AND_AMOUNT. Customer is allowed to pay a different amount than the one retrieved in proxy method call.

Sample RENEW Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "productsCodes": [],
                                        "customerNumber": 291631845,
                                        "smartcardNumber": 2005129242,
                                        "customerName": "K AKINTIMEHIN",
                                        "invoicePeriod": 1,
                                        "monthsPaidFor": 1,
                                        "subscriptionType": "STANDARD",
                                        "amount": 2500
        },
                                        "id": 6,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AQC"
}

CHANGE SUBSCRIPTION option should be used only in case the customer would like to change the current product / add-ons he/she is subscribed to at the moment. Product codes of new products and add-ons MUST BE included in request in this case.

Sample Request Body:
{
                                        "details": {
                                        "productsCodes": [
                                        "GOTVPLS"
                ],
                                        "customerNumber": 291631845,
                                        "smartcardNumber": 2005129242,
                                        "customerName": "K AKINTIMEHIN",
                                        "invoicePeriod": 1,
                                        "monthsPaidFor": 1,
                                        "subscriptionType": "STANDARD",
                                        "amount": 1800
        },
                                        "id": 6,
                                        "paymentCollectorId": "CDL",
                                        "paymentMethod": "PREPAID",
                                        "serviceId": "AQC"
}

Cancellation is not available for this service

4.12.5. Proxy

Several proxy operations are available for this service. The field requestType in details parameter is used to tell apart different proxy operations.

Used to check if smart-card number is valid. If so returns the customer name, account status, due date and customer number. This proxy method should be called as entry method for all options.

It is used to validate the customer account. This is default Startimes proxy method. Therefore, requestType is an optional field in this proxy method, and it can be omitted.

Parameter Name Type M / O Description

string

M

Customer’s smart card number

string

O

Hard-coded value "GET_CUSTOMER_BALANCE".

                                            "requestType": "GET_CUSTOMER_BALANCE"
        },
                                            "serviceId": "AWA"
}

Parameter Name Type M / O Description

returnCode

string

M

Response code. 0 signifies success

customerType

number

M

Customer type - Prepaid:1, Postpaid:2

billAmount

number

M

Bill Amount

balance

number

M

Current customer balance

string

M

Response message

smartCardNumber

string

M

Customer’s smart card number from the request

customerNumber

String

O

Customer number from the request. At the moment we support only identification through smart card number so this parameter will for now always be null

string

M

Customer’s name

4.22. Eko Electricity Distribution Postpaid

This service covers paying bills for postpaid Eko EDC customers. Maximum purchase amount is 100.000N.

In most cases the initial response will be an error stating that the transaction is still pending (Error Code: EXC00114). In order to resolve the issue it is required to call the Query method. The transaction should be resolved within 2 minutes.

4.22.1. Service ID: AVA

4.23. Eko Electricity Distribution Prepaid

4.23.1. Service ID: BAA

4.23.2. Exchange:

This service covers purchasing prepaid tokens Eko EDC customers. Maximum purchase amount is 100.000N, minimum amount is 1000N in case of no outstanding debt.

In most cases the initial response will be an error stating that the transaction is still pending (Error Code: EXC00114). In order to resolve the issue it is required to call the Query method. The transaction should be resolved within 2 minutes.

4.27. Kaduna Prepaid

4.27.1. Service ID: CDA

4.27.2. Exchange

This service covers purchasing prepaid tokens for Kaduna customers.

In some cases the initial response will be an error stating that the transaction is still pending (Error Code: EXC00114). In order to resolve the issue it is required to call the Query method. The transaction should be resolved within 1 minute.

4.37.5. Proxy

Several proxy operations are available for this service. The field requestType in details parameter is used to tell apart different proxy operations.

Get policy info

Used to retrieve information on an existing policy. Information from the response is supposed to be used to Renew this policy.

Request Body: 'details' parameter:
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

requestType

string

M

Hard-coded value "GET_POLICY_INFO"

vehicleRegistrationNumber

string

M/O

Vehicle registration number from an existing policy. If this value is provided, the lookup will occur based only on this value.

policyNumber

string

M/O

Policy number of an existing policy. Lookup will occur based on this parameter in case vehicle registration number was not provided.

uniqueReference

string

M/O

Unique reference (transaction number) from the original policy purchase on Baxi. Lookup will occur based on this parameter only if vehicle registration number or policy number have not been provided.
Sample Request Body
{
                                            "details": {
                                            "vehicleRegistrationNumber": "BG919CX",
                                            "requestType": "GET_POLICY_INFO"
  },
                                            "serviceId": "CMA"
}

5. Security

The BAXI REST API uses a custom HTTP scheme based on a keyed-HMAC (Hash Message Authentication Code) for authentication. To authenticate a request, you first concatenate selected elements of the request to form a string. You then use your BAXI secret access token to calculate the HMAC of that string. Informally, we call this process "signing the request," and we call the output of the HMAC algorithm the signature, because it simulates the security properties of a real signature. Finally, you add this signature as a parameter of the request by using the syntax described in this section.

When the system receives an authenticated request, it fetches the BAXI secret access token that you claim to have and uses it in the same way to compute a signature for the message it received. It then compares the signature it calculated against the signature presented by the requester. If the two signatures match, the system concludes that the requester must have access to the BAXI secret access token and therefore acts with the authority of the principal to whom the key was issued. If the two signatures do not match, the request is dropped and the system responds with an error message.

5.1. The Authentication Header

The BAXI REST API uses the standard HTTP Authorization header to pass authentication information. (The name of the standard header is unfortunate because it carries authentication information, not authorization.) Under the BAXI authentication scheme, the Authorization header has the following form:

Authorization: 'MSP '[BAXI USERNAME]:Signature

Organizations are issued a BAXI username and BAXI secret access token. For request authentication, the username element identifies the access token that was used to compute the signature and, indirectly, the organization making the request.

The Signature element is the RFC 2104 HMAC-SHA1 of selected elements from the request, and so the Signature part of the Authorization header will vary from request to request. If the request signature calculated by the system matches the Signature included with the request, the requester will have demonstrated possession of the BAXI secret access token. The request will then be processed under the identity, and with the authority, of the organization to whom the token was issued.

Following is pseudo-grammar that illustrates the construction of the Authorization request header.

Authorization = "MSP" + " " + [BAXI USERNAME] + ":" + Signature;

Signature = Base64(HMAC-SHA1([BAXI SEC. TOKEN], UTF-8-Encoding(StringToSign)));

Token is Base64 encoded string so before usage it must be decoded first.

HMAC-SHA1 is an algorithm defined by RFC 2104 - Keyed-Hashing for Message Authentication. The algorithm takes as input two byte-strings, a key and a message. For BAXI request authentication, use your BAXI secret access token ([BAXI SEC. TOKEN]) as the key, and the UTF-8 encoding of the StringToSign as the message. The output of HMAC-SHA1 is also a byte string, called the digest. The Signature request parameter is constructed by Base64 encoding this digest. 

StringToSign = [HTTP-Verb] + "\n" + Base64(SHA256(Content)) + "\n" + [x-msp-date] + "\n" + [servlet-path];

Explanation:

  • In the example, \n means the Unicode code point U+000A, commonly called newline

  • [HTTP-Verb] � HTTP method - POST, GET

  • Base64(SHA256(Content)) � Base64 encoded SHA256 hash of the body request (JSON objects in our case)

  • [x-msp-date] � value of the x-msp-date header, previously described

  • [servlet-path] � servlet path

  • Base64(SHA256(Content)) + "\n" � this part should not be present in the case there is no request body

This is a sample of the request for purchasing an MTN pin of 100N:

  • HTTP-Verb : POST

  • BAXI username: fbn1

  • BAXI security token: MsYE+kaiEWYd743SWRZtUiIJf5AAje07vkF6WVEm0aTxk2cbUmONUsloHEL8bpK3AWQvRe4/aTiIKwK/aBMfCw==

  • x-msp-date: Mon, 18 Jan 2016 10:14:26 GMT

  • servlet-path: /rest/consumer/v2/exchange

  • JSON Body request: {"details":{"numberOfPins":1,"pinValue":100,"amount":100,"providerFee":0,"serviceFee":0},"id":3,"paymentCollectorId":"CDL","paymentMethod":"PREPAID","serviceId":"ALB"}

  • StringToSign:

    POST

    ze/LSIEESC6I42VHDZ7QyODkAZPGOeF41YF55w1IAQ0=

    Mon, 18 Jan 2016 10:14:26 GMT

    /rest/consumer/v2/exchange

    Authorization header: MSP fbn1:1IVPLqHFZ/Lf6YCsVEXAki7RZko=

6. Error Handling

In case a problem occurred on the service provider platform, BAXI platform simply forwards the response from the service provider platform, containing the error message and code. Error codes and descriptions for individual services will be provided separately.

In the event of an error occurring on the BAXI platform, a response will contain an error code and error message describing the problem. A list of possible error codes will be provided in Appendix B.

Response Body for error on BAXI platform
Parameter Name Type M / O Description

code

String

M

Error code

message

String

M

Error message

For instance, in case the service requested is currently not available for sale, a following message will be sent:

Sample Response Body:
{
                                "code": "EXC00109",
                                "message": "Service with code 'AEA' is blocked."
}

Appendix B: BAXI Error Codes

PROG0001: Programming error on platform. (Should contact CDL support)

PROG0002: Programming error on platform. (Should contact CDL support)

PROG0003: Programming error on platform. (Should contact CDL support)

SEC00001: Bad credentials

SEC00002: User account has expired.

SEC00003: User credentials has expired.

SEC00004: User is not active.

SEC00005: User is blocked.

SEC00100: Unknown authentication error. (Should contact CDL support)

SEC01001: Access is denied.

UNK0001: Unknown error on platform. (Should resolve through API - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

EXC00001: Exchange has failed for unpredicted reason. (Should contact CDL support)

EXC00100: Service code is not recognized. (Should check client implementation)

EXC00102: Not enough funds available to complete the exchange.

EXC00103: Requested service is not active. (Should contact CDL support)

EXC00105: Balance could not be obtained. (Should resolve through API - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

EXC00107: Cancellation of exchange was rejected by the provider. (Should contact CDL support)

EXC00109: Service is blocked. (Service is temporarily not available. Should resolve through API once service is back online - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

EXC00112: Query of exchange failed because exchange was never registered on platform. (Can be safely treated as if the transaction is failed)

EXC00113: Exchange is already cancelled by the provider.

EXC00114: Exchange is still pending. (Should resolve through API - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

EXC00115: Exchange was not sent to the provider.

EXC00116: The exchange request was already registered on the platform with same ID but with different values. (Should check client implementation)

EXC00117: There was an error while calculating commissions. (Must contact CDL support immediately)

EXC00118: Sent service fee is invalid.

EXC00119: Payment collector code is not recognized. (Should check client implementation)

EXC00123: Service is not allowed.

EXC00124: Provider platform did not respond in timely manner. (Should resolve through API - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

EXC00125: The exchange request is not valid.

EXC00126: The cancellation failed. (Must be resolved through Query API call)

EXC00127: The exchange amount is too high.

EXC00130: Payment method not recognized. (Should check client implementation)

EXC00131: The exchange request is not allowed at the moment. (Can occur if there is a time limit restriction specified for the details provided in the Exchange request - for instance in case the same meter number cannot be used in a specified interval more than once)

EXC00133: Provider platform API has unhandled inconsistencies! (Should check client implementation and contact CDL support immediately! This error occurs when the details provided in the Exchange method call do not follow the rules specified in the document and can result in irreversible loss of funds!)

EXC00144: Platform is not available to receive new requests for exchange at the moment. (Should resolve through API - using Exchange / Query calls as described in Chapter 2)

For any other error contact CDL support.
